nodes.bodyText: This looks correct to me. The only thing is, should we pull out that line in front of 'if' statement (and remove it from globalMarkPhase)?

This can be done, however globalMarkPhase method is used in one other place, for Global GC in runGlobalGarbageCollection.
We'll have to account for this clearing in runGlobalGarbageCollection as well then.
setupBeforeGlobalGC is a common method called before globalMarkPhase for both GlobalGC and GMP, and its used exclusively by the 2. Perhaps the clearing can be moved up to there

I'm not super familiar with this code, would like to confirm this change or simply take path of least changes.
Another "safer" solution is pull out the clear from globalMarkPhase and add explicitly have the clear before calling globalMarkPhase at both call sites.

Those are good observations. Moving it to setupBeforeGlobalGC sounds very reasonable (simple and safe).
BTW, there is another point where clearing is done in IGGC::internalPreCollect. I believe  this path is taken when doing final STW increment of GMP. It may become redundant if we introduce a clear for any increment of GMP. Hard to say without actually running and verifying it.
@gza060625 this PR can be wrapped up with the changes discussed above
I think we should rename this to getIncrementStallTime

Both class and instance name has 'Increment' in them.  I tend to avoid to repeat those attributes in method names.
I'd either keep getTotalStallTime or simply call it getStallTime (that's the name used in various OMR Stats struct).
a simple validation check: in GMP increment you should never see non-zero stats from _copyForwardStats
@gza060625 added some validation asserts as part of testing, this being one of them. They were removed after testing, Should they added?
yes, it's ok to add some asserts
This file should stay untouched, no changes in here.
This should be moved down, before line 1005
GC work (which will update the increment stats) actually happens after this
This should be moved down as well, before line 1122. As before, GC work (which will update the increment stats) actually happens after this
